parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To bear gently with, have compassion. From a compound of the base of metrios and pathos; to be moderate in passion, i.e. Gentle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To do not know, be ignorant of, sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To lead astray, deceive, cause to wander. From plane; to roam.
Of time: when, after; of cause: since, because; otherwise: else. From epi and ei; thereupon, i.e. Since.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and keimai; to lie all around, i.e. Inclose, encircle, hamper.
From asthenes; feebleness; by implication, malady; morally, frailty.
